section.title: Description
section.p: An Observation of whether the Patient is known to be expecting and/or when the Patient last experienced a menstrual cycle. This information is needed in multiple situations where a procedure or medication is being contemplated that could be harmful to a fetus. For example, a clinician may wish to avoid exposing the Patient to X-Rays if she is pregnant. Naturally, this information is only recorded for female patients of childbearing age.

stentry.p: Indicates whether the Patient is known to be expecting.
The date when the Patient last experienced a menstrual cycle. This date may be imprecise (e.g., sometime in February of the current year).
